greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Perform one x^2 -> x+1 reduction for the polynomial with nonnegative integer coefficients that is encoded in the prime factorization of n.
comment: Completely multiplicative with a(2) = 2, a(3) = 3, a(prime(k)) = prime(k-1) * prime(k-2) for k > 2. - _Andrew Howroyd_ & _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 04 2018
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10080
mathematica: a[n_] := a[n] = Module[{k, p, e}, Which[n<4, n, PrimeQ[n], k = PrimePi[n]; Prime[k-1] Prime[k-2], True, Product[{p, e} = pe; a[p]^e, {pe, FactorInteger[n]}]]];
program: A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 15 2015
ext: Keyword mult added by _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 04 2018
